email.subject: CfP: 7th International Workshop on Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems (FMAS 2025)

conference.name: 7th Workshop on Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems
conference.co_located_with: International Conference on Integrated Formal Methods (iFM) 2025

types.theme: research directions into Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems
well-defined research ideas in early stages
practical experiences in applying Formal Methods to Autonomous Systems

call_for_papers.description: FMAS welcomes submissions that use formal methods to specify, model, or verify autonomous systems.
topics: Experience Reports on formal methods or tools

journal_opportunity.description: We will organise a journal special issue to collect extensions of papers accepted in FMAS 2025.

scope.description: FMAS 2025 is a 2.5-day peer-reviewed international workshop that brings together researchers working on a range of techniques for the formal verification of autonomous systems.
challenges: Verifying decision making capabilities including planning, ethical, and reconfiguration choices
Using formal methods results as evidence for certification or regulatory organizations
welcome_submissions: Use of formal methods to specify, model, or verify autonomous systems
Integrated formal methods combining multiple methods in software engineering
Advancing applicability of formal methods for autonomous systems

submission_details.review_process: Each submission will receive at least three single-blind reviews
submission_details.registration_requirements: At least one author must register and attend workshop for accepted papers

awards.best_paper: FMAS 2025 will honour the best paper selected on various criteria
awards.special_issue: A journal special issue will collect extensions of accepted papers

poster_session.description: FMAS 2025 will include demos and posters co-located with iFM2025

venue.description: FMAS 2025 will be co-located with the International Conference on Integrated Formal Methods (iFM) 2025.

participation.in_person: At least one author must register and pay for on-site attendance
participation.remote: Participating online is free, but must inform organizers
